issue.title: [bug] app name with "-" in it fails on mobile builds

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

app name with "-" in it fails on mobile builds

### Reproduction

_No response_

### Expected behavior

npm create tauri-app@latest -- --rc
project name 'tauri-test'

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
[âœ”] Environment
    - OS: Mac OS 14.5.0 X64
    âœ” Xcode Command Line Tools: installed
    âœ” rustc: 1.77.0 (aedd173a2 2024-03-17)
    âœ” cargo: 1.77.0 (3fe68eabf 2024-02-29)
    âœ” rustup: 1.27.0 (bbb9276d2 2024-03-08)
    âœ” Rust toolchain: stable-aarch64-apple-darwin (default)
    - node: 20.13.1
    - npm: 10.5.2

[-] Packages
    - tauri [RUST]: 2.0.0-rc (no lockfile)
    - tauri-build [RUST]: no manifest (no lockfile)
    - wry [RUST]: no manifest (no lockfile)
    - tao [RUST]: no manifest (no lockfile)
    - @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 2.0.0-rc.0
    - @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 2.0.0-rc.3

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - frontendDist: ../dist
    - devUrl: http://localhost:1420/
    - framework: Vue.js
    - bundler: Vite

[-] iOS
    - Developer Teams: Interactive Brokers LLC (ID: L6H6D9Q7DY)
```


### Stack trace

```text
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at src/mobile/mod.rs:272:6:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: IdentifierInvalid { identifier: "app.tauri-mob.com", cause: NotAsciiAlphanumeric { bad_chars: ['-'] } }
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```


### Additional context

_No response_

body:
Hi,
I am having the same issue. It used to be possible to have `_` in the android application name but since the last updates, this is not possible anymore. I have published an android application with an underscore and now cannot update it anymore due to that. I would be happy with the solution proposed by almost-senseless-coder.

I think it is related to this change https://github.com/tauri-apps/cargo-mobile2/commit/29921ff025ebed31546e33dc82696dc0c8fce2e0, but I am really not sure as I don't have a deep knowledge of the way tauri works.

@FabianLars It looks like you don't have the manpower to handle that. What would be your preferred solution? 

- Allowing `-` in the identifier and converting it for Android 
- Having an option to manually specify the appid for android (and other OS will be implemented later if needed)?
- Something else?
I personally would lean towards the first option, but not sure. Let's ask @lucasfernog and @amrbashir

> Hi, I am having the same issue. It used to be possible to have `_` in the android application name but since the last updates, this is not possible anymore. I have published an android application with an underscore and now cannot update it anymore due to that. I would be happy with the solution proposed by almost-senseless-coder.
> 
> I think it is related to this change [tauri-apps/cargo-mobile2@29921ff](https://github.com/tauri-apps/cargo-mobile2/commit/29921ff025ebed31546e33dc82696dc0c8fce2e0), but I am really not sure as I don't have a deep knowledge of the way tauri works.

I wonder how you manage to do so ðŸ˜‚ looks like we need even more changes to support `_` in the package identifier

issue.title: feat(macros): allow Android domain parts to have underscores

repository.name: tao
repository.description: The TAO of cross-platform windowing. A library in Rust built for Tauri.

issue.body:
Ref https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/9707

<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(windows): fix race condition in event loop
    - docs: update docstrings
    - feat: add `Window::set_fullscreen`

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. If there is a related issue, reference it in the PR text, e.g. closes #123.
3. If this change requires a new version, then add a change file in `.changes` directory with the appropriate bump, see https://github.com/tauri-apps/tao/blob/dev/.changes/readme.md
4. Ensure that all your commits are signed https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits
5. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
6. Open as a draft PR if your work is still in progress.
-->

body:
> > Hi, I am having the same issue. It used to be possible to have `_` in the android application name but since the last updates, this is not possible anymore. I have published an android application with an underscore and now cannot update it anymore due to that. I would be happy with the solution proposed by almost-senseless-coder.
> > I think it is related to this change [tauri-apps/cargo-mobile2@29921ff](https://github.com/tauri-apps/cargo-mobile2/commit/29921ff025ebed31546e33dc82696dc0c8fce2e0), but I am really not sure as I don't have a deep knowledge of the way tauri works.
> 
> I wonder how you manage to do so ðŸ˜‚ looks like we need even more changes to support `_` in the package identifier

I am good enough to break anything :joy: 

There was a few modifications required for my app in the `build.gradle.kts` which I managed by simply modifying it in my repository (including the appid). Unfortunately, there has been some changes in tauri that forces the appid in `build.gradle.kts` to match the identifier in the configuration file. If they don't match, I get an undefined reference to in `Logger.kt`. I tried making links, moving directories, copying files, ... but it does not work.

I know it is not something very standard, so I am ready to help if you need.

issue.title: [bug] Tauri Panics On New App Creation

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

Did  ```$ yarn create tauri-app --rc```
Running ```yarn``` went ok
Running ```$ yarn tauri ios init``` caused a panic

### Reproduction

``` 
$ yarn create tauri-app --rc
yarn create v1.22.22
[1/4] ðŸ”  Resolving packages...
[2/4] ðŸšš  Fetching packages...
[3/4] ðŸ”—  Linking dependencies...
[4/4] ðŸ”¨  Building fresh packages...
success Installed "create-tauri-app@4.2.0" with binaries:
      - create-tauri-app
âœ” Project name Â· tauri-rc
âœ” Identifier Â· com.tauri-rc.app
âœ” Choose which language to use for your frontend Â· TypeScript / JavaScript - (pnpm, yarn, npm, bun)
âœ” Choose your package manager Â· yarn
âœ” Choose your UI template Â· React - (https://react.dev/)
âœ” Choose your UI flavor Â· JavaScript
...
...
...
```
THEN
```yarn``` [works fine]
THEN
```
$ yarn tauri ios init
yarn run v1.22.22
$ tauri ios init
thread '<unnamed>' panicked at src/mobile/mod.rs:283:6:
called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: IdentifierInvalid { identifier: "app.tauri-rc.com", cause: NotAsciiAlphanumeric { bad_chars: ['-'] } }
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
    Error Tauri CLI unexpected panic
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
$
```

### Expected behavior

There should be no panic

### Full `tauri info` output

```text
$ yarn tauri info
yarn run v1.22.22
$ tauri info

[âœ”] Environment
    - OS: Mac OS 14.6.1 X64
    âœ” Xcode Command Line Tools: installed
    âœ” rustc: 1.80.0 (051478957 2024-07-21)
    âœ” cargo: 1.80.0 (376290515 2024-07-16)
    âœ” rustup: 1.27.1 (54dd3d00f 2024-04-24)
    âœ” Rust toolchain: stable-aarch64-apple-darwin (default)
    - node: 18.18.0
    - pnpm: 9.0.5
    - yarn: 1.22.22
    - npm: 9.8.1
    - bun: 1.1.7

[-] Packages
    - tauri [RUST]: 2.0.0-rc (no lockfile)
    - tauri-build [RUST]: no manifest (no lockfile)
    - wry [RUST]: no manifest (no lockfile)
    - tao [RUST]: no manifest (no lockfile)
    - @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 2.0.0-rc.2
    - @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 2.0.0-rc.6

[-] App
    - build-type: bundle
    - CSP: unset
    - frontendDist: ../dist
    - devUrl: http://localhost:1420/
    - framework: React
    - bundler: Vite
âœ¨  Done in 4.83s.
$
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

body: Fix will be released soon. Note that you'll need to run `cargo update` in the src-tauri folder to apply it.

> Fix will be released soon. Note that you'll need to run `cargo update` in the src-tauri folder to apply it.

Thanks a lot for the quick fix!
I can confirm that the fix works with tauri-cli rc7. Thanks for your help!
